instructions: From any Home screen, tap the Apps icon. Tap Settings . Tap Mobile data . Tap Access Point Names . If available, tap the T-Mobile Data APN (the bullet point fills with green). If not available, tap the Menu icon, and then tap New APN. To reset your APN settings, tap the Menu key and then tap Reset to default . Verify and update the following settings for the Data APN: Name: T-Mobile US LTE APN: fast.t-mobile.com Proxy: <Not set> Port: <Not set> Username: <Not set> Password: <Not set> Server: <Not set> MMSC: http://mms.msg.eng.t-mobile.com/mms/wapenc MMS proxy: <Not set> MMS port: <Not set> MMS protocol: WAP 2.0 MCC: 310 MNC: 260 Authentication type: <Not set> APN type: <Not set> OR Internet+MMS APN protocol: IPv4/IPv6 APN roaming protocol: IPv4 Enable/disable APN: <greyed out unless there are multiple APN's> Bearer: Unspecified Tap the Menu button. Tap Save . Tap the desired APN profile you want to use. The bullet point fills with green next to the APN profile.
From any Home screen, tap Apps . Tap Settings . Tap Mobile data . Tap Network operators . Tap Search networks . Select the desired network.

From any Home screen, tap Apps . Tap Settings . Tap Mobile data . Tap Network Mode . Select an option: WCDMA only to use a 3G connection only. GSM only to use a 2G connection only. GSM / WCDMA auto to use a 4G connection when available. GSM / WCDMA / LTE auto to use an LTE connection when available.

From any Home screen, tap Apps . Tap Settings . Tap Mobile data . Tap Network Mode . Select an option: 3G only to use a 3G connection only. 2G only to use a 2G connection only. 2G/3G auto to use a 4G connection when available. 2G/3G/4G auto to use an LTE connection when available.
Press and hold the Power key. Tap Airplane mode to turn on or turn off.

From any Home screen, tap Apps . Tap Settings . Tap Mobile data . Select the Data roaming check box. Tap OK . If desired, select the Data roaming sound check box to play a sound when connecting to a roaming network.
From any Home screen, tap Apps . Tap Settings . Tap More . Tap Data usage . Tap the Mobile data slider to turn it on or off.
